skill.name: expo-api-audit
skill.description: Comprehensive audit of Expo/React Native app API integration layer. Use when asked to: (1) Review API interactions, auth handling, or token management, (2) Find hardcoded data or screens bypassing API, (3) Verify user interactions properly sync to backend, (4) Analyze offline behavior and caching, (5) Audit Orval/OpenAPI code generation, (6) Check for API security issues. Supports TanStack Query, Zustand, axios, Expo Router, expo-secure-store, and expo-constants patterns.

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill containing documentation and grep/ripgrep command examples for manual audit procedures. No executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond Claude's standard capabilities.

content.value_statement: Expo and React Native apps often have hidden API issues like hardcoded tokens, missing auth handling, and data that never syncs to the backend. This skill provides systematic checks to find and fix these problems before they cause security incidents or data loss.
actual_capabilities: Find hardcoded credentials and API URLs in source code
Verify token storage uses expo-secure-store instead of AsyncStorage
Detect forms and user actions that do not sync to the backend
Audit Zustand stores for server state that should be API data
Check offline behavior and caching patterns with React Query
Review Orval/OpenAPI generated code against API specifications
limitations: Does not execute on the codebase - provides commands for Claude to run manually
Cannot fix issues automatically - only identifies and reports them
Requires ripgrep or grep to be available in the environment
Does not test running application behavior - static analysis only

prompt_templates.title: Quick audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run an API integration audit on this Expo app. Check for hardcoded data, direct API calls bypassing generated hooks, and forms that do not sync to the backend.

prompt_templates.title: Auth security check
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit the authentication layer. Verify tokens use expo-secure-store, check for process.env usage with secrets, and confirm 401 handling works correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Offline behavior review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check offline behavior and caching. Verify React Query networkMode is set correctly, find missing error boundaries, and confirm data serves stale when offline.

prompt_templates.title: Full codebase assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive API integration audit. Cover: auth token handling, direct API violations, screen data sources, Zustand store patterns, offline configuration, and generate a markdown report with severity levels.

output_examples.input: Run an API integration audit on my Expo app
output: Found 2 critical issues: tokens stored in AsyncStorage (services/auth/tokenStorage.ts:15), process.env.API_URL in api/client.ts:8
Found 3 major issues: profile edit form not syncing (app/profile/edit.tsx), hardcoded URL in settings screen, Zustand store holding fetched user data
Found 2 medium issues: missing error boundaries in app screens, no offline queue for mutations
Recommendation: Migrate token storage to expo-secure-store, add useUpdateProfile mutation, refactor Zustand to only hold client state

best_practices: Run this audit before every release to catch integration regressions early
Fix critical security issues first - hardcoded credentials and insecure token storage
Use the generated report to create actionable tickets for your team
anti_patterns: Storing tokens in AsyncStorage instead of expo-secure-store
Using process.env for API configuration in Expo production builds
Keeping business data in Zustand stores instead of server state management

faq.question: Which React Native versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Expo SDK 48+ and React Native 0.73+. Checks for expo-secure-store, expo-constants, and TanStack Query patterns.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: No limits - this is a static analysis tool that runs grep commands. Results depend on codebase size and command execution speed.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my CI pipeline?
faq.answer: Copy the grep commands from the skill into a script. Run as part of your pre-commit checks or CI security stage.

faq.question: Is my data safe during audit?
faq.answer: Yes - this skill only reads files locally. No data is sent anywhere. Commands run against your local codebase only.

faq.question: Commands fail with no output
faq.answer: Ensure ripgrep is installed (brew install ripgrep) or grep is available. The skill includes fallback commands for systems without ripgrep.

faq.question: How is this different from eslint?
faq.answer: ESLint enforces syntax rules. This skill finds architectural issues - missing API syncs, incorrect state management, and security anti-patterns.
